greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of non-unimodal negated permutations of a multiset whose multiplicities are the prime indices of n.
comment: This multiset is generally not the same as the multiset of prime indices of n. For example, the prime indices of 12 are {1,1,2}, while a multiset whose multiplicities are {1,1,2} is {1,1,2,3}.
A sequence of integers is unimodal if it is the concatenation of a weakly increasing and a weakly decreasing sequence.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Unimodal Sequence
xref: The complement of the non-negated version is counted by A332294.
The complement is counted by A332741.
A less interesting version is A333146.
Partitions with non-unimodal 0-appended first differences are A332284.
Compositions whose negation is unimodal are A332578.
Partitions with non-unimodal negated run-lengths are A332639.
Numbers whose negated prime signature is not unimodal are A332642.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 09 2020
